context.title: Résorption-bidonvilles,
context.subtitle: A platform to boost the resorption of shantytowns
context.text: A tool for information, sharing and steering, the platform offers a high-performance and effective solution for slum clearance. It enables the collaboration of all local stakeholders involved in the slum clearance policy.

1.text: It's great because you have the info online, you're not faced with an excel spreadsheet with codes you don't understand.
1.author: Prefecture Seine-Saint-Denis

2.text: The platform made the information more reliable because, before the Excel table was not shared. The more collaborative tools we have, the better it is.
2.author: City of Poitiers

3.text: I was able to direct the family of a person I was accompanying to a solidarity house from the location of their slum.
3.author: Haute-Garonne Association

secondSection.title: Reaching slum clearance,
secondSection.subtitle: a national objective
secondSection.firstParagraph: A slum is an area that usually lacks basic services (water, electricity, waste management) and is illegally occupied by several families.

secondParagraph.bold: The government sets a clear objective of shanty town resorption by moving away from an evacuation-centred approach to a global approach.
secondParagraph.normal: combining social inclusion, respect for public order and prevention of resettlement. In all the territories concerned, effective, humane and pragmatic multi-partner actions must be implemented.
secondParagraph.link: More about the shantytown resorption policy

secondBanner.text: Neighbour, citizen, shantytown dweller... Any news? A question ? An alert?

firstParagraph.bold: In 2019, more than 30 slum clearance projects have been carried out by 35 NGOs
firstParagraph.normal: They have been financed 75% by the State, 15% by local authorities and 10% by private or European funds. Families living in slums have been supported in order to access to health, housing, employment, education and sanitation.

secondParagraph.title: A project led by the interministerial delegation for access to housing (DIHAL)
